patterns.name: Broadening Bottoms
patterns.description: This pattern forms at the tail end of a downtrend. The pattern takes on the appearance of a megaphone as the price forms a series of higher highs and lower lows throughout the formation. The pattern needs at least two highs and lows to be a valid formation.
patterns.volume: The volume should diminish through the pattern up until the breakout
patterns.breakout_confirmation: A close above the upper trend-line on above average volume.
patterns.measuring_technique: Measure from the highest high to the lowest low before the breakout, and add that amount to the highest high for the price target.
patterns.statistical_notes: Year lows tend to perform better.

patterns.name: Broadening Tops
patterns.description: This pattern forms at the tail end of an uptrend. The pattern takes on the appearance of a megaphone as the price forms a series of higher highs and lower lows throughout the formation. The pattern needs at least two highs and lows to be a valid formation.
patterns.volume: The volume should diminish through the pattern up until the breakout
patterns.breakout_confirmation: A close below the lower trend-line on above average volume.
patterns.measuring_technique: Measure from the highest high to the lowest low before the breakout and subtract that amount from the lowest low for the price target.
patterns.statistical_notes: Year highs tend to perform better.

patterns.name: Bump-and-Run Reversal Bottoms
patterns.description: This pattern is comprised of three phases and looks similar to a frying pan. There is the lead-in phase, the bump phase and the uphill run. The bump phase forms a flat or rounded bottom. The uphill run phase is after the breakout.
patterns.volume: Volume is typically high at the beginning of each phase and decreases throughout each phase.
patterns.breakout_confirmation: A close above the upper trend-line drawn across the highs during the lead-in phase, with above average volume.
patterns.measuring_technique: The price target is the highest point of the lead-in phase.
patterns.statistical_notes: Wider formations tend to perform better than narrower formations, and a throwback hurts performance.

patterns.name: Bump-and-Run Reversal Tops
patterns.description: This pattern is comprised of three phases and looks similar to a mountain range. There is the lead-in phase, the bump phase and the downhill run. The bump phase forms a flat or rounded top. The downhill run phase is after the breakout.
patterns.volume: Volume is typically high at the beginning of each phase and decreases throughout each phase.
patterns.breakout_confirmation: A close below the lower trend-line drawn across the lows during the lead-in phase, with above average volume.
patterns.measuring_technique: The price target is the lowest point of the lead-in phase.
patterns.statistical_notes: Wider formations tend to perform better than narrower formations, and a pullback hurts performance.

patterns.name: Cup and Handle
patterns.description: This pattern occurs within the context of a longer uptrend and is characterized by the price forming a u-shaped cup with a short handle on the right. The duration of the cup should last at least 7 weeks if using a daily chart.
patterns.volume: Volume follows the shape of the cup: high as the left lip forms, falling at the bottom, rising toward the right lip and on breakout.
patterns.breakout_confirmation: A close above the upper trend-line drawn across the handle with above average volume.
patterns.measuring_technique: Measure from the right lip to the bottom of the cup and add that amount to the right lip price.
patterns.statistical_notes: Shorter handles and deeper cups with left lip slightly higher than the right lip perform better.

patterns.description: Equal highs and rising lows forming a triangle. Typically breaks out 2/3 to 3/4 of the way to the apex.
patterns.volume: Declines throughout formation and expands on breakout.
patterns.confirmation: Close above highs on above average volume.
patterns.measuring_technique: Subtract lowest low from highest high and add to breakout level.

patterns.description: Equal lows and falling highs forming a triangle. Typically breaks out 2/3 to 3/4 of the way to the apex.
patterns.volume: Declines throughout formation and expands on breakout.
patterns.confirmation: Close below lows on above average volume.
patterns.measuring_technique: Subtract highest high from lowest low and subtract from breakout level.

patterns.description: Three equal lows with horizontal resistance breakout.
patterns.volume: Drifts downward during formation and expands on breakout.
patterns.confirmation: Close above upper trend-line across intervening highs with above average volume.
patterns.measuring_technique: Measure distance between high and lows and add to breakout level.

patterns.description: Three equal highs with horizontal support breakdown.
patterns.volume: Drifts downward during formation and expands on breakout.
patterns.confirmation: Close below lower trend-line across intervening lows with above average volume.
patterns.measuring_technique: Measure distance between low and highs and subtract from breakout level.
